puzzles.clue: Violent seismic movement that affects the Earth's crust.
Molten rock that erupts from volcanoes during an eruption.
Liquid element essential for life, composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
Movement of water or air in a determined direction.
Mountain or chimney from which gases, ash, and lava emerge.
Loud and continuous noise, like an explosion.
Large mass of saltwater that covers most of the Earth.
Overflow of water that covers normally dry land.
Meteorological phenomenon with rain, wind, and sometimes lightning.
Atmospheric precipitation formed by ice crystals.
Body of water flowing towards a lake or the sea.
Expanse of land used for cultivation or grazing.
Tropical storm of great intensity with very strong winds.
Shallow body of water, generally isolated from others.
Arid region with little vegetation due to water scarcity.
Central star of our solar system that provides light and heat.
Large fish that inhabits the oceans.
Undulating movements of water reaching the shore.
Air vortex that spins violently over the land.
Sudden movement of the Earth's crust.
Waste material or objects that no longer have use.
Action of a plant or tree producing flowers.
Mild wind blowing for a short time.
Celestial body that orbits around a star.
Rocky body orbiting the sun, usually small.
Celestial body emitting its own light due to nuclear reactions.
Cloud of gas and dust in space, where new stars are born.
Region in space where gravity is so strong that nothing can escape.
Imaginary line where the sky seems to meet the land or sea.
Luminous phenomenon produced by charged particles from the sun.
Natural satellite of Earth, visible at night.
Farm animal of great size, symbol of strength.
Electric discharge that occurs during a storm.
Meteorological phenomenon with storms, rain, and wind.
Set of animals inhabiting an area or region.
Set of plants inhabiting a region.
Spherical object that rises in the air with gas.
Carnivorous and dangerous fish inhabiting the oceans.
Reptile with a long body and no legs.
Animal covered in feathers, capable of flight.
Natural elevation of the earth, generally taller than a hill.
Very deep area in the sea or land.
Something unknown that generates intrigue or doubt.
Nocturnal mammal with wings.
Marine animal that forms reefs in the ocean.
Cold-blooded vertebrate animal that typically has scales.
Translucent marine animal with a bell-shaped body.
Occurrence when one celestial body moves into the shadow of another.
Strong tropical storm with high winds and rain.
Collection of water vapor suspended in the sky.
Precipitation of water droplets from clouds.
Overflow of water that covers dry land.
Large area covered chiefly with trees.
Land surrounded by water.
Large ocean wave caused by an underwater earthquake.
Mountain that erupts with lava and ash.
Light and warmth that comes from the sun.
